timeline.bodyHTML:
I think these kind of validations, could be simplified into a function that takes lambda as argument, example:

private <T> void checkAndSetConfigs(final Message message, final String key, final Consumer<T> fn, final Class<T> type) {
        final T header = message.getHeader(key, type);
        if (!ObjectHelper.isEmpty(header)) {
            fn.accept(header);
        }
    }

to call it:

checkAndSetConfigs(msg, "CamelOaimphVerb", harvester::setVerb, String.class);

For the URI, you may need to add the a wrapper from URI to String somewhere that creates URI.create(header)
